intro: Acetosella coquimbana, commonly known as the Coquimbo sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant is adapted to grow in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal areas. It produces small, edible fruits that are rich in vitamin C. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
